message: Yeah. We've talked about it a lot in irc. Some interesting things, some changes have a high WTF factor.
One unfortunate factor is he duplicated a *lot* of features which had existing patches, which is at best wasted effort and at worst a tricky political situation re: author/idea credit.
i saw the blog post and was really interested, but then I cried a little when I saw his git repo
In his defense (on both counts, features + git repo) this was largely a "shit I need for me" effort on his part and he just decided to write some docs and share it

The repo might be suboptimal, but now that I switched to "his" fabric, I can't picture myself going back. The parallel commands are just too awesome when you have more than a dozen of hosts (multirun etc.)
@jpetazzo Have  you checked out Morgan's parallel execution branch? It's slated for inclusion in Fabric 1.2 but is quite usable even now. https://github.com/goosemo/fabric
@mattg  You mean that he's got all projects in one repo so it's hard to work with the specific fork of fabric? If so, I just thought the same :S
